entry.title: 18th Niue Assembly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Premier Dalton Tagelagi (pictured) appointed the first cabinet of Niue with equal gender representation in the 18th Niue Assembly?

entry.title: PBS Appalachia Virginia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that PBS Appalachia Virginia is the first all-digital public TV station in the United States?

entry.title: 1934 Central Eagles football team (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the conference-champion 1934 Central Eagles football team had a reserve squad known as the Rinkeydinks?

entry.title: Battle of New Carthage (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the martial booty seized by the Romans after the Battle of New Carthage included 63 merchant ships, numerous catapults, large amounts of weapons and more?

entry.title: Valentina Bodrug-Lungu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Valentina Bodrug-Lungu has declared that Moldova's political climate does not encourage female participation, despite having a woman president?

entry.title: White Antelope (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the song supposedly sung by Cheyenne chief White Antelope as he died at the Sand Creek massacre has been used at remembrances commemorating the event?

entry.title: Unlock It (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Charli XCX retitled "Unlock It" after it went viral on TikTok?

entry.title: Sid Justin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sid Justin almost became a Miracle, but he turned it down to play professional football?
